channel.title: linux on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Alpine
item.description: Alpine Linux is a Linux distribution designed to be small, simple, and secure.

item.title: awk
item.description: AWK is a domain-specific language designed for text processing and typically used as a data extraction and reporting tool.

item.title: Configuration (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about how to configure linux.

item.title: Debian
item.description: The Linux Debian operating system is used as the base for many other linux operating systems such as Ubuntu and the Raspberry Pi OS (formerly Raspbian).

item.title: Dell Inspiron 7537 - Preventing Linux shutdown when closing the lid
item.description: This is a little post about how to prevent a Dell Inspiron laptop from shutting down or going into standby when you close the lid on the laptop.

item.title: Docker
item.description: Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. The service has both free and premium tiers. The software that hosts the containers is called the Docker Engine.

item.title: Docker (run) commands
item.description: This page contains examples about the use of Docker commands when running containers.

item.title: Docker build
item.description: This page contains examples about the use of Docker commands when building containers.

item.title: Environmental Variables (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about the use of environmental variables in linux.

item.title: Files
item.description: File and file permissions are core to the security model used by Linux systems.

item.title: grep
item.description: grep is a command-line utility for searching plain-text data sets for lines that match a regular expression.

item.title: Helm
item.description: Helm helps you manage Kubernetes applications — Helm Charts help you define, install, and upgrade even the most complex Kubernetes application.

item.title: Hoverfly
item.description: Hoverfly is a tool written in go which can be used to simulate API.

item.title: inotifywait
item.description: inotifywait a linux tool that waits for changes to files using inotify

item.title: K3s
item.description: K3s - Lightweight Kubernetes. Easy to install, half the memory, all in a binary of less than 100 MB.

item.title: K3s on Raspberry Pi
item.description: A project to set up a small scale multi worker Kubernetes instance at home (sometimes called a ‘home lab’).

item.title: K3s with customised Traefik Ingress
item.description: This post contains some details on how to customise the k3s (default) traefik ingress controller.

item.title: Linux
item.description: Linux is a family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel, an operating system kernel first released on September 17, 1991, by Linus Torvalds.

item.title: Linux Tools
item.description: This page contains links to the Linux (and Unix) specific tools that I have discovered, and documented, as a part of my development journey.

item.title: Monitoring Tools (Linux)
item.description: This page provides information about some linux specific monitoring tools.

item.title: openHAB
item.description: Open Home Automation Bus (openHAB) is an open source home automation software written in Java. It is deployed on premises and connects to devices and services from different vendors.

item.title: OpenSSL
item.description: OpenSSL is a software library for applications that provide secure communications over computer networks against eavesdropping or need to identify the party at the other end.

item.title: Pi-hole
item.description: Pi-hole is a Linux network-level advertisement and Internet tracker blocking application which acts as a DNS sinkhole and optionally a DHCP server, intended for use on a private network. It is designed for low-power embedded devices with network capability, such as the Raspberry Pi, but can be installed on almost any Linux machine.[

item.title: Raspberry Pi
item.description: The Raspberry Pi is a series of small single-board computers (SBCs) developed in the United Kingdom by the Raspberry Pi Foundation in association with Broadcom.

item.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)
item.description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux is a commercial Linux distribution developed by Red Hat for the commercial market.

item.title: RetroPie
item.description: Installing/Enabling the Pixel Desktop The PIXEL (formerly LXDE) desktop environment was removed from the RetroPie image to keep it smaller. It can easily be installed from the RetroPie Setup Script (~/RetroPie-Setup/retropie_setup.sh) In Configuration / Tools » Raspbiantools » Install Pixel Desktop Environment After installation, it will be accessible from the ports menu of EmulationStation or can be called from the command line with startx For more details see where did the desktop go

item.title: rsync
item.description: rsync is a fast, versatile, remote (and local) file-copying tool for linux.

item.title: Running Stable Diffusion on low resource PC (Dell Inspiron 7537)
item.description: This page documents my efforts to get Stable Diffusion running on my old Dell Inspiron 7537 laptop.

item.title: sh - Shell Command Language
item.description: sh (or the Shell Command Language) is a programming language described by the POSIX standard. It has many implementations (ksh88, dash, …). bash can also be considered an implementation of sh.

item.title: sleep
item.description: In computing, sleep is a command in Unix, Unix-like and other operating systems that suspends program execution for a specified time.

item.title: System Information (Linux)
item.description: Examples of how you get information about your linux system and hardware.

item.title: systemd
item.description: Systemd is a suite of basic building blocks for a Linux system. It provides a system and service manager that runs as PID 1 and starts the rest of the system.

item.title: Ubuntu
item.description: Ubuntu is a Linux distribution based on Debian and composed mostly of free and open-source software.

item.title: Unix VI text editor
item.description: vi is a screen-oriented text editor originally created for the Unix operating system.

item.title: Wireguard (VPN)
item.description: WireGuard® is an extremely simple yet fast and modern VPN that utilizes state-of-the-art cryptography.
